page.title: 01LITTLE GADDESDEN AREA
page.content: The greater part of the block consists of farm and woodland.The only built up area is Little Gaddesden and Ringshall .Farm buildings and other dwellings are scattered.Employment was mostly on the land or at Ashridge House until the Ashridge Estate was sold prior to the war.The cottages were workers' houses.Now the village is 80% commuter to offices and outside works and the houses have been improved into very expensive dwellings.There are council houses and Old Peoples' bungalows.A good proportion of the land is managed by the{National Trust.}It is a beautiful area populated by 1400 people.There is a Church,School, Swimming Pool,Garage,Hotel and Shop.The amenities are few but the Clubs and Societies plentiful.Many Hikers and Walkers travel this area of the{Chiltern Hills.
